page.title: 08FARMING _ POYNTINGTON AREA
page.content: Most of the land is occupied by 4 {large farms}which vary in size from 250_600 acres.About 5 farms are of less than 100 acres.Most are owner farmed,a few tenanted or part tenanted There are also a few outlying fields with different owners.{Produce}is mainly grain/wheat/barley/oats/oilseed rape.{Livestock Holdings}are divided between beef cattle(Hereford x Friesian);dairy cattle(Friesian);sheep (various x breeds);horses and the rearing of gamebirds.Grass is cut for both silage and hay.{Markets}used for exchange of cattle and sheep are at Yeovil and Sturminster Newton. {Geology:}Soil is mostly dry and calcareous derived from inferior colite with Yeovil sands in many of the valleys.Several disused quarries contain building stone,ammonites and belemnite fossils.
